text: You dream of dancing in a palace made of ice and feasting on delicate sugar candies in the shapes of birds and fish.
You dream of riding at the head of a hunting party, the hounds panting as they chase after fleeing humanoid forms.
You dream of a duel in the rain, fought with swords made of lightning.
You dream of sitting on a throne as criminals are brought before you for judgement.
You dream of repairing shoes.
You dream of a well-kept house, everything in its place.
You dream of spinning straw into gold.
In your dreams, you watch from above the fire in the hearth as the children play with blocks and the dog sleeps in the kitchen.
You dream of flying through the night on raven's wings.
You dream of running on all fours through a field of wheat.
You dream of tracking a badger's scent back to its lair.
You dream of a raven landing on your outstretched arm and telling you what it saw while on the wing.
You dream of looking up at the sun from beneath the surface of the water.
You dream of frolicking in the seafoam.
You dream of slipping on your skin and the shiver as your skin turns to fur and your hands to flippers.
You dream of bumping a fishing boat and giggling as the rod falls in the water.
Your dreams are filled with the round of pickaxes striking rock.
You dream of finding a rich vein of ore.
You dream of watching the moon set from the mouth of a cave.
You dream of watching a pair of humans pass by, oblivious to you among the rocks.
